results.title: Man Locks His Own Head In A Metal Cage To Give Up Smoking
results.summary: A Turkish man, Ibrahim Yucel, used a metal cage helmet to stop smoking after many failed attempts. Addiction deeply impacts lives. Globally, tobacco causes over 8 million deaths yearly, says WHO. Second-hand smoke kills 1.2 million. In India, tobacco causes 1.35 million deaths. Smoking during pregnancy harms babies. This highlights the destructive nature of addiction and its impact on individuals and society, mirroring the Bible's call for temperance and avoiding enslavement to harmful habits (1 Corinthians 6:12).

results.title: India Must Rethink Self-Reliance Strategy Amid Global Shifts
results.summary: Dhiraj Nayyar argues India's broad "aatmanirbharta" (self-reliance) strategy needs refinement as global protectionism rises. He notes India faces higher US tariffs than China, highlighting vulnerabilities in oil, gas, defense, and critical minerals. Nayyar suggests a selective approach, leveraging entrepreneurial talent and structural reforms. The article aligns with recognizing worldly challenges but lacks explicit faith-based solutions, contrasting with biblical reliance on God's provision (Philippians 4:19).
